comment: I've a legacy control station (and I know all room and device numbers). Unfortunately it's just a gamble to get the assignments right. Worked on one  phone; didn't work out on another phone. Currently daily use is still more inconvenient than the original cocu/kaku app.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: I think you are misunderstanding the app. You cannot set up multiple phones independently and expect them to work. Set up one phone then use the backup/restore feature to transfer your data with all of the assignments.

title: Work in progress

author: Niall Leonard
comment: Ugly, flawed. Error code appears demanding​ I register my phone with LWRF hub. There's nowhere to do that in the app. Error code persists on-screen even when app closed. Really irritating. Huge ugly icons look like program from Windows 95. Haven't got to use app yet cos of error above. Will review if I ever get it to work

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Yes it's showing its age now. I have a better one but it isn't released yet. You register your device on the hub not in the app (exact same as official app). If you dont like the icons, change them. They are fully customisable.

author: james cannell
comment: Lightwaverf are idiots. Here is someone doing something positive and proactive to unlock the potential of lwrf hardware. Keep up the good work

author: Grant Hutchings
comment: Can't set the app up. Had the app on an old phone and how all it does it loads the old data and won't update. Such a shame as this used to work amazingly with Tasker.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: read the in-app manual or contact support if you need help but it works exactly like the official remote controls. Comments here are only checked infrequently so please do not post here if you want a reply.

author: Tony Jackson
comment: For me it's better than the "official" one. Quick, easy to set up and yes it may look a bit dated in places but it does exactly what I want it to. Good job.

author: Tom Smith
comment: Didn't work, waste of money

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: It does work if you set it up correctly. Try before you buy with the fully functional trial. If you need help setting it up, submit a support ticket and I will help you.

author: Xavier Bailliet
comment: Why does this app requires access to contacts? Beware!!!

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: As the app explains, it does not request or use your contacts. It requests access to your email address to start you a trial. Unfortunately on later versions of android, this permission is part of the "contacts" permission group. Look at the actual permissions in the play store listing and you will  not find any requests for your contact list.

author: James Addis
comment: it's quite a mess

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: and discontinued some time ago but it served its purpose at the time which was to allow widgets, Tasker, Wear, and TV functionality that was not available via official channels. https://plus.google.com/communities/103928048963799525594

author: Tony Carroll
comment: Love this app for the auto voice pluggin

author: Neil Constant
comment: I purchased as only three options available switch dimmer and relay. How do I connect a 2 gang socket. The options are not there. Am I doing something wrong. Thanks for responding  but all the items are missing that are in your screenshots. Have requested refund from Google as it does not allow my to request refund even though it's not been 2 hours

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Works the same way as the official app. Sockets are switch Devices. I.e they switch on and off. Contact support or read the manual if you need help.

title: Not working

comment: Can be difficult to pair if u have alot of lwrf priducts they seem to join together but not sure if problem with app or lwrf

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Pairing is done by the devices not the software. I only have 350 characters to respond so no room to explain it but open a support ticket on web site and I will explain in full

title: Works well

author: jonathan eke
comment: Have always loved this app much better than the official app use the widgets on my s2 gear to open my garage door and gate in conjunction with wareable widgets only wish the voice command option would work on my s2 gear
title: John

author: Greg Coss
comment: I had problems with Android N. This has now been fixed with an update. Excellent support in terms of fix and response time. Why can't all developers by this good?

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Now tested on 6P with N and no issue. You really need to raise a support ticket if you haven't already but a 1 star review is rather unfair as N has only just been released.

title: Was crashing on Android N. Now fixed

author: Chris Dowsett
comment: This really brings my newly installed system up to-date with voice control. The adds on the free version are not a big issue and when paid for there are a thing of the past. Well worth the money!
title: Love it

author: Doug Johnston
comment: Have been using this app now for around two years, to remote control bedroom sockets on timers. This is easier to set up on this app than the standard LightwaverRF app. It is a good app and I am very pleased with it.

author: James Farley
comment: Not keen on giving an app heavily geared to ads requiring access to my address book to operate at all.  Uninstalling.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: it doesn't ask for or use your contacts at all. it requests your email address to give you the trial. this unfortunately is under the contacts group. it shows ads whilst in trial mode. hardly "heavily geared"

author: Steve Beech
comment: Like it's integration with Tasker.

author: Bret Whitcombe
comment: Tried this app as an alternative, instilled for the first time today to find that 1. The app is not free as advertised and 2. The app will not run as the trial Expired March! I'll be happy to purchase and re-review if the 7 day trial is fixed and it's confirmed to be ad free.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Please read app description as is advertised as trial not free. no ads after purchasing. if your trial has expired, you must have requested one previously. Either request a new trial with a different Google account or contact support with your email address and I will happily reset it for you. you really don't need to do the usual 1 star protest.

title: Trial Expired Before Installed!

author: Adam Cox
comment: App it self is not very intuitive and I've hardly used it but widgets feature is v.good and worth buying just for this

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: you have probably not changed your settings since you upgraded your LightwaveRF account.. please read the instructions in the release notes for the app. seriously though, why are you even using the app when every comment you make here is to say how bad it is.

title: Not fantastic

author: Luveh Keraph
comment: This app does not seem to do anything beyond what the official (free) app does - it just has more in the way of eye candy and gimmicks. In addition, most annoyingly it makes it difficult to log into one's account: one is supposed to tap on an icon labeled EDIT, on the top right - but, on phones, as opposed to phablets and tablets, that icon can be seen only when the phone is held in landscape position. This is very poor design.  A GUI so poorly designed does not make me confident about other, more complex chores, that the app is supposed to tackle. I will definitely stay with the official app. Actually, the more I look into this app, the worse it is. After logging into my account, it just offers some generic settings, rather than my specific ones, as the official app can do. This app is eye candy and nothing else.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: The Edit entry in the menu is visible whenever you press the menu button regardless of screen orientation. This app is for advanced users as it offers control via Tasker, NFC, widgets and desktop shortcuts. If you don't want to do that then the official app will work just fine for you even though I would say the GUI in that is far worse than mine

author: William Garnett
comment: Some nice advantages over LightwaveRF app. Some improvements needed. More later
title: Still looking at it

author: Rob X
comment: Short-sighted developers. Better too have limited functionality for trial version. At least it's made my decision which products to buy easier

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: The trial lasts 7 days as it told you at the start. You can always fill in a support ticket asking for an extension. I tried a limited function trial and got  1 star reviews for it (how do we know we like it if we can't use it all) so you can't please everyone although as most of your reviews are 1 star I doubt you would like it whatever I did.

title: Trial version expired so app closes

author: Carl Turner
comment: Nice layout but can't operate anything outside my Wi-Fi range and the energy monitor doesn't work (I have tested the monitor independently and it is ok).

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Fill in a support ticket re monitor. Lightwaverf have a habit of changing things and not telling anyone. There are at least 2 versions of the energy monitor and lightwaver is only tested with the one i have. you need to log in to control devices when not on WiFi. see the user manual for instructions or I can guide you if you get in touch .

title: Not for me

author: Darren Bentham
comment: The energy monitor doesn't work any more.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Still works for me. Perhaps your energy monitor doesn't work? Fill in a support ticket if you don't believe this is the case. Lightwaverf have a habit of changing things and not telling anyone. There are at least 2 versions of the energy monitor.

title: Great app but...

author: Colin Baseman
comment: Much better interface than the official app.  Great support from the developer.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: I responded within 30 minutes and closed the ticket 2 days ago as you had not got back to me. Perhaps you should check your spam folder for the notification. Regardless, the ticket was answered and is available for you to see (with the date of response) if you log back in. This message was answered in 3 minutes.

author: Darren Taylor
comment: Can not get to work. I have a galaxy S4 and on start the app opens and just crashes. Is there a fix?

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: sorry found a problem. fixing now but please contact me if you have issues. I only check these reviews about once a week. My stats show this issue has affected 59 different people. Not one reported it.

title: Looks Great. BUT!

author: Stephen Burridge
comment: The latest release (after lightwaverf changed loads) has meant having to effectively redo all my tasker plugin commands,  but it's all working again now.  Good job!
title: Still so much better than the official app

author: Gary Davies
comment: Adds so much functionality from the widgets alone. Good insight into how people want to use this kit. I may upgrade this rating after I've tried the tasker integration. If you have LWRF kit you should get this!!

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: why wait? upgrade it now :-)

title: Well worth the price

author: Test Pilot
comment: Is it possible to turn on lights and devices using 'ok google' 'front room on' instead of having to press the mic on your apk.  Will change to 5*and buy if you can help.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: not yet. Google's api is too restrictive and currently would require every room and device name to be known in advance.

title: Looks good. Please help

author: Andrew Bingham
comment: So much better than the 'official' app. With the tasker integration I can now fully control my home from my smart watch.
title: Brilliant

author: Chris Jennings
comment: Great app
title: Lightwaver

author: Glen Pearson
comment: Just having to wait until I can get a pin from the official site so I can use this over the net

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: you would have received an automatic response directing to our support site. we do not offer email support.

title: Great App

author: keiron paterson
comment: Has the functionality missing from the official app, like adding certain commands to the home screen. invaluable
title: Great app

comment: Lightwaverf should  be embarrassed,  this app is everything the official version should  be even after the recent 'upgrades'.  Android TV works brilliantly, really happy. Lwrf should give Kuffs a job and stop messing about.
title: Fantastic

author: Boomba Lartee
comment: This app does everything the official app doesn't, turns a mediocre system into a brilliant one. Thank you Kruffs!!!
title: Exactly what you need!

author: Karsten Süggel
comment: I log in with my account, but it shows a different email and different wifi link, please Help!

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: Lightwaver does not need or allow login and only uses your LightwaveRF account to download your data from their official portal. It also does not "show" any email or any wifi links so your comments are confusing. Are you sure you are commenting about the correct app? Contact support with a full description of your issue if you need help

author: David Brown
comment: Been using this since the beginning of time and still find it excellent.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: thank you. much appreciated.

title: Still excellent

author: Jonny Wilson
comment: App appears to be free. Only when you install it does it let you know you need to purchase it after 7 days. It is a little clunky looking with limited icons. May be amazing for some but for me, I tried it after LightwaveRF's app and gave up after 3 mins.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: The very first words in the description of the app in Play Store are "This is a 7 day trial version" so hardly sneaky. I guess you just didn't read it. You cannot expect all apps to be free. Do you work for nothing? Limited icons? You can add your own so are completely unlimited. Enjoy the official app (which has unchangeable monochrome icons)

title: Too clunky & sneaky charging

author: Rhys Orwin
comment: I'm using this with tasker in so many ways. NFC triggers, auto voice, app export. It just works flawlessly. The only downside is that the UI is not that attractive. Luckily I'm almost always using it through the plugin. Great work dev!!

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: If there is sufficent demand, I'll be  hopefully updating the UI to be more Material design after I complete my other (currently unreleased) app.

title: Fantastic with Tasker

author: Chris Nash
comment: Much more reliable than the official app and works really well over mobile data connection.

reply.author: Kuffs
reply.content: open a support ticket or post on the Google Plus community site and tell me what you are looking for. All icons etc are 100% customisable so tell me what you think needs improvement. I think it looks good but I'll admit that I'm a little biased. always open to feedback.

title: Pretty good
